SENT.plain: Eight patients with a clinical diagnosis of lateral medullary (Wallenberg's) syndrome were studied with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) at 1.5 Tesla
On T1-weighted axial images, small hypointense lesion (infarct) was demonstrated in the region of lateral medulla in 6 patients
Ipsilateral hemiatrophy of the medulla was revealed in one patient
In the remaining one patient, a thrombosed vertebral artery was disclosed
It was therefore concluded that MRI is useful diagnostic modality for Wallenberg's syndrome
